The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them. Just when you think it's all clear and danger-free,...For some people and characters it wasn't.
If there's something this movie has going for itself, is that the premise seems intriguing at first to me. Although I am used to watching romance movies (

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie. Usually I fall asleep on the sofa or after we go to bed with my alarm set for the third period of an Oilers game on HNIC. But this was disturbing, and NOT what one expects during a Batman movie.

Sorry everyone

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though, some smooth motions used to illustrate the flow and simulate emotions as well as good music.
A complete parody on itself and this genre of film.
Not worth your time at all unless you are a huge fan of Hello Kitty or found lost gambling chips in that rusty belt buckle grandma always talked

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have found safe haven in Fantasy space for with enough money one becomes emigrant. Who hates the wealthy for their ease fate and con arguments to get by. The world as we know it has crumbled so much. Poor writing index I'm shocked you just read the blurb

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or logic throughout, but I reject that type and asked you to watch it without any negative presceptions. Despite its title “Harden My Soul” this is a low budget jokey parody with playful performances of cheeseball
